title: BBC Local Live: Merseyside on Friday 20 May 2016 - BBC News
summary: cammell laird confirms it is to cut 68 jobs at its shipyard in birkenhead .
liverpool john lennon airport is evacuated after a problem with the scanner leads to a security alert .
elderly woman dies after her car plunges into the water at the docks in waterloo , liverpool .
queen tribute band apologises after a band member wore a sun t-shirt in a show in liverpool .
three liverpool men are convicted of £ 130,000 cash machine raids in aberdeenshire .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates from merseyside and west cheshire have finished for the day , but we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with the latest news , sport , weather and travel from around the region .

documents.title: weather : some heavy rain
text: rain spreading eastwards , with some heavier and more persistent outbreaks developing over higher ground .
turning breezy , as freshening south-westerly winds develop along the coast through the night .

documents.title: pc dave phillips to be awarded freedom of wirral
text: a merseyside police officer , described as a hero after being killed in the line of duty , will receive wirral 's highest honour this evening .
pc dave phillips died when he was hit by a stolen truck in wallasey last year .
his family will attend a special ceremony where he will be posthumously awarded the freedom of the borough .

documents.title: plain packaging introduction 'could cut smokers '
text: the liverpool-based roy castle lung cancer foundation says there is evidence that plain packaging on cigarettes would reduce the number of smokers .
all new packets of cigarettes on sale in the uk now have to be in plain packaging with graphic health warnings .

documents.title: man , 67 , arrested over runcorn bomb hoax
text: a 67-year-old man has been arrested over a hoax bomb threat in runcorn .
it was made from a phone box in high street early on thursday morning and claimed a device was inside a shopping centre .
the man is now being questioned .

documents.title: drugs gang jailed over £ 6m heroin haul inside furniture
text: a gang that smuggled heroin with a street value of £ 6m inside a shipment of furniture has been jailed .
hafiz akhtar , 34 , mohammed yaqub , 34 , and abdul wahid , 37 , were sentenced to 15 years , 11-and-a-half years and seven years respectively at manchester minshull street crown court .
the consignment was found inside a shipping container sent from pakistan to royal seaforth docks in liverpool in april 2012 .

documents.title: apology over 'the sun ' t-shirt
text: the singer in the queen tribute band has apologised on bbc radio merseyside after the band 's guitarist wore a t-shirt with the sun newspaper 's logo on during a show in liverpool .
many audience members walked out of the empire theatre when the bass guitarist performed in the top .
singer gary mullen insists it was just a costume and the band had no idea how the newspaper was viewed in merseyside .

documents.title: latest headlines for merseyside and west cheshire
text: this evening 's top stories in merseyside and west cheshire :

documents.title: residents shocked over death of woman whose car plunged into dock
text: residents of a liverpool dockland apartment block have spoken of their shock after an elderly woman died when her car ploughed into the water .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: 'no security threat ' at john lennon airport
text: officials at liverpool john lennon airport insist there is no security threat - after the departure lounge had to be evacuated .
there was a technical problem with a scanning machine so all passengers were removed and their luggage had to be re-checked .
at no stage was there a threat to passenger safety , an airport spokesperson confirmed .

documents.title: soldier callum cowan found dead at his barracks in germany
text: a soldier from st helens serving with the british army was found dead at his barracks in germany , an inquest has heard .
author: St Helens Star

documents.title: dartmoor prison kitchen knife killer given life term
text: a convicted killer from liverpool who stabbed a fellow inmate to death with a knife he had been given to chop vegetables has been given another life sentence .
william tolcher , 51 , killed alex cusworth in the kitchen of dartmoor prison last november .
tolcher was already 15 years into a life sentence for murdering a woman in newquay in 1996 .

documents.title: cammel laird jobs to go
text: cammell laird has confirmed it is cutting 68 jobs at its shipyard in birkenhead .
the company , which is set to build the polar research ship which the public voted to name boaty mcboatface , says it needed to address its cost base to remain competitive .
the union unite said a ballot for possible industrial action over the redundancies closes on monday .

documents.title: hillsborough survivor meets 'hero ' rescuer after viral appeal
text: a hillsborough survivor has finally met the man who pulled him from the crush as an eight-year-old boy 27 years ago .
joe smith , 35 , launched a facebook appeal after seeing himself on the shoulders of his rescuer while watching a bbc two documentary .

documents.title: group of men and teenagers charged with serious sex offences are named
text: fourteen men and teenagers accused of rape have been named .
author: Chester Chronicle

documents.title: david ginola has quadruple heart bypass
text: former france winger david ginola is recovering in hospital in monaco after a quadruple heart bypass operation .
the 49-year-old former newcastle , tottenham , aston villa and everton player - who retired in 2002 - collapsed in the south of france on thursday .
he tweeted to say : `` hello world , never slept better .
i 'm fine , just need to rest a bit . ''
hello world , never slept better .
i 'm fine , just need to rest a bit .
thank you so much all of you for your magnificent support .
can u take a selfie so i can relax my hearts in my mouth !
the guy has just had heart surgery & you 're asking him to 'take a selfie ' # 21stcenturyproblems
we did n't know this at the time , also i was concerned some was tweeting while he was rumoured to be in coma .
do n't judge !
he tweeted saying he was fine & needed rest & you 're asking him for a selfie .
truly embarrassing
it was n't him tweeting u moron !
jog on ! ! ! ! !
get well soon david .
pleased to hear it pal !
so shocked and worried about your news .
stay strong & healthy and your fans will always be supporting and loving you
take it easy david .
your legion of fans in the uk will be glad that you are making a good recovery .
great news !
tottenham hotspur fc audere es facere facebook fan page send best wishes to you for your recovery - rest up and come back well
get well soon david .
great to hear you 're on the mend .
# spurslegend # coys
good to hear .
get well soon # coys
god bless
so pleased you are on the mend xx
get well soon david
one of the best players ever to wear a spurs shirt .
good luck in your recovery legend .
so pleased and relieved to hear you are on the mend .
take care .

documents.title: liverpool men convicted of £ 130,000 atm raids
text: thieves have been found guilty of using explosives to blow up cash machines in a series of raids which netted more than £ 130,000 across aberdeenshire .
joseph mchale , 38 , kevin schruyers , 42 , and robin vaughan , 43 , all from liverpool , were part of a gang who targeted atms .

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: today 's top stories in merseyside and west cheshire :

documents.title: jobs boost for chester based bank of america merrill lynch
text: around 1,000 jobs are due to come to bank of america merrill lynch in chester by 2020 .
author: Phil McCann
Cheshire Political Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: liverpool airport security error delays 1,000 passengers
text: up to 1,000 passengers were barred from boarding flights at liverpool john lennon airport because of a security incident .
the departure lounge was evacuated at about 12:00 because of a technical problem with one of the scanning machines .

documents.title: convicted killer who stabbed inmate sentenced to life
text: a convicted killer who stabbed a fellow prisoner to death with a prison-issue kitchen knife , has been sentenced to life imprisonment with a minimum term of 33 years .
alex cusworth ( 37 , was stabbed by 51-year-old william tolcher in dartmoor prison last november .
a jury at plymouth crown court found tolcher guilty yesterday .
tolcher , from liverpool , was already 15 years into a life sentence for murdering a woman in newquay in 1996 .
the court heard he had 30 convictions for 72 offences .
the judge said : `` the parole board may never consider you fit for release i am sure you are an extremely dangerous man because you have murdered two persons . ''

documents.title: elderly residents preyed on in spate of distraction burglaries
text: elderly residents have been targeted during a spate of distraction burglaries in newton-le-willows .
author: St Helens Star

documents.title: airport : passengers re-enter departure lounge after evacuation
text: airport : passengers re-enter departure lounge after evacuation
author: Bay TV
Bay TV Liverpool

documents.title: airport : statement from liverpool john lennon airport
text: please follow the link for the official statement on the removal of passengers from departures
always better to be safe than sorry x
exactly polly !

documents.title: travel : rail disruption at liverpool moorfields
text: trains are n't stopping on merseyrail northbound at liverpool moorfields due to engineering works .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: witnesses sought as woman dies after car plunges into waterloo quay
text: a woman 's died after her car plunged into a dock in liverpool .
the accident happened at waterloo quay this morning .
officers are working to identify the woman and contact her next of kin .
witnesses are asked to contact the the roads policing team on 0151 777 5747 .

documents.title: airport : no security threat after terminal evacuated
text: officials at liverpool john lennon airport insist there is no security threat after the terminal had to be evacuated .
there was a technical problem with a scanning machine so all passengers were removed from the departure lounge and their luggage is now being re-checked .
at no stage was there a threat to passenger safety .
the latest flight information can be found here .

documents.title: watch : hillsborough survivor reunited with man who saved his life
text: joe smith appealed on facebook to find the man who carried him away from the packed terraces at hillsborough .
he saw john mcmahon on a bbc two documentary .

documents.title: liverpool airport evacuation : latest flight information
text: please visit for the latest on the removal of passengers from ljla .
there is no threat to passenger security .

documents.title: liverpool airport evacuation : 'no threat to passengers '
text: liverpool airport has been evacuated .
this is the statement on its website :

removal of passengers from departure lounge 20/05/16 : due to a technical problem with one of the airport 's passenger scanning machines , all passengers have been removed from the departure lounge and are currently in the process of being rescreened .
there is no threat to passenger safety

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: today 's top stories in merseyside and west cheshire :

documents.title: liverpool airport evacuated after security alert
text: liverpool airport is being evacuated after a security alert .

documents.title: hillsborough survivor finally meets man who rescued him
text: a hillsborough survivor has finally met the man who pulled him from the crush as an eight-year-old boy 27 years ago .
joe smith , 35 , launched a facebook appeal after seeing himself on the shoulders of his rescuer while watching a bbc two documentary .
the post was shared 145,000 times and was seen by john mcmahon who had hoisted joe on to his shoulders to get him away from the packed terraces .
he sent a message saying : `` hey the person you 're looking for - it 's me . ''

documents.title: merseyside families living with dementia make films about their memories
text: merseyside families who are living with dementia have helped to make and star in a series of short films about the disease .
the reflections project saw people with dementia record their memories on film during a series of workshops - the films were screened at woolton picture house .

documents.title: warrington care home stabbing : woman , 66 , detained
text: a woman has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after a 68-year-old woman was stabbed at a care home in cheshire , the bbc understands .

documents.title: weather : cloudy with bright spells and some rain later
text: nw : cloudy with brighter spells later .
a few isolated showers to look out for .
patchy rain this evening .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: elderly woman dies after her car plunges into water at waterloo
text: an elderly woman has died after the car she was driving went into the water at waterloo quay .
police and the fire service were called to the scene at 9:40 after reports of a car seen in the water .
the woman was removed from the car and efforts were made to resuscitate her but sadly she later died in hospital .

documents.title: a car has gone into water at waterloo dock in liverpool
text: a car has gone into water at waterloo dock in liverpool
author: Bay TV
Bay TV Liverpool

documents.title: breakingcar plunges into docks at waterloo
text: a car went into the water this morning at the docks in waterloo .
police and the fire service were called to the scene just after 9:30 this morning .
more information to follow .

documents.title: distraught dog owner warns others about risk of walking dogs in orford field
text: a distraught dog owner is warning people to take care while walking their pets after her dog died within hours of eating something sus on an orford field .
author: Warrington Guardian

documents.title: pc dave phillips to be awarded freedom of wirral
text: a ceremony will be held at wallasey town hall later to posthumously award pc dave phillips the freedom of wirral .
the 34-year-old was killed in october last year when he was struck by a stolen truck on the wallasey dock link road .
council leader phil davies says pc phillips ' death `` touched the whole of merseyside '' , and serves as a reminder of `` the dangers police officers face '' .

documents.title: suspect arrested on sus of attempted murder after stabbing in burtonwood
text: a 66-year-old woman was arrested on sus of attempted murder after a care home resident was stabbed multiple times in the back , neck and face .
author: Warrington Guardian

documents.title: travel : birkenhead tunnel lane closed due to broken down bus
text: there is queuing traffic and one lane is closed in the birkenhead tunnel ( queensway ) inbound from the toll booths to liverpool city centre because of a broken down bus .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest headlines in merseyside and west cheshire
text: today 's top stories in merseyside and west cheshire :

documents.title: southport air show wins people 's choice at liverpool city region tourism awards
text: sefton council 's tourism team are celebrating after winning the prestigious people 's choice award at the liverpool city region tourism awards .
author: Southport Visiter

documents.title: queen tribute act apologise for sun t-shirt 'oversight '
text: the lead singer of a queen tribute band has apologised after a member of the band wore a t-shirt with the sun 's logo on it during a show in liverpool last night .
many audience members walked out of the empire theatre when the bass guitarist refused to change the top during the one night of queen event .

on his twitter page the singer says `` we are trying to re-create the 1986 magic tour , and were completely unaware of the significance of the print worn we are devastated to have made this oversight . ''
liverpool is one of our favourite cities , and we are devastated to have made this oversight .
difficult situation that you recovered , well done : )
thank , again our apologies , we were completely unaware of the situation .
that was apparent & the vast majority of your audience knew that.inflammatory situation that you dealt with a good show x
if it 's one of your favourite cities , how could you have not known the significance of that ?
as i said in the interview today , it was an oversight on our part , and a genuine mistake .
27 years a city has n't bought the sn and you call it 'an oversight ' ?
i call it ignorance and stupidity .
you handled it well .
do n't beat yourselves up about it .
it was a brilliant show and hope you will be back again soon .
it was all handled well , as a member of the audience i could see this was a genuine mistake .
you 'll never walk alone was g8
the people who swore at you should be apologizing .
you clearly did n't know .
liverpool always loves you guys !

documents.title: liverpool 's alder hey launch appeal to raise £ 6m for next building phase
text: liverpool 's alder hey children 's hospital is launching an appeal to build the second phase of its world leading research centre that solely focuses on children 's medicine .

the first phase of the institute in the park opened earlier this year , and they 're now trying to to raise £ 6m to extend the building so they can develop better treatments for children and young people .

documents.title: travel : congestion at the rocket
text: slow traffic on the m62 and a5058 queens drive into liverpool at the rocket .
more from bbc travel
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: david duckenfield 's wife : 'hillsborough has been terrible for us too '
text: the wife of shamed hillsborough match commander david duckenfield today claimed : it 's terrible for us too . ''
- ann duckenfield also said she fears for her husband 's future .
author: Liverpool Echo

documents.title: dartmoor prison murder : convicted killer from liverpool guilty of stabbing
text: a convicted killer from liverpool has been found guilty of stabbing a fellow prisoner to death with a prison issue kitchen knife .
william tolcher , 51 , denied attacking alex cusworth , 37 , with the 10in ( 23cm ) knife at dartmoor prison last november .
a jury at plymouth crown court found him guilty of murder and he is due to be sentenced on friday .
tolcher is serving a life sentence for the murder of a woman in newquay , cornwall , in 1996 .

text: today 's top stories in merseyside and west cheshire :

documents.title: weather : a mostly dry day but chance of rain later
text: scattered showers at first then mostly dry with some sunshine .
it will cloud over later on so expect some spots of rain .
highs of 17c .

author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live news coverage
text: hello from liverpool , i 'm here with all your news , sport , travel and weather updates from across merseyside and west cheshire today .
if you 've got a story you 'd like me to hear about or a photograph you 'd like to share , you can contact me on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jenny Coleman
Reporter, BBC Local Live
